intro: Conyza arborescens, commonly known as horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Conyza arborescens is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
